title: Python get_attr on DT_FLOAT returns proto type, not python DType
body_html:
If my graph has a Sub operation, and I get the "T" key for the op, it always returns an integer type incorrectly.

op: "Sub"
input: "ResizeBilinear"
input: "Sub/y"
attr {
  key: "T"
  value {
    type: DT_FLOAT
  }
}

print(ops[8].get_attr("T"))
1

print(type(ops[8].get_attr("T")))
int

body:
If my graph has a Sub operation, and I get the "T" key for the op, it always returns an integer type incorrectly.

```
op: "Sub"
input: "ResizeBilinear"
input: "Sub/y"
attr {
  key: "T"
  value {
    type: DT_FLOAT
  }
}
```

```
print(ops[8].get_attr("T"))
1

print(type(ops[8].get_attr("T")))
int
```
